synopsis.text:
Yakumo Yuurakutei, a legendary Rakugo artist, has never taken an apprentice until he meets an unusual man named Yotaro. Yotaro, a former prisoner with a newfound passion for Rakugo, is determined to turn his life around and become a master of the art form. After being moved by Yakumo's performance of 'Shinigami,' Yotaro seeks out the master and is given the nickname 'Yotaro,' which means 'anti-hero' or 'dim-witted man.' Yakumo takes Yotaro under his wing, and the two begin a new life together in the world of Rakugo.

As Yotaro learns the ins and outs of Rakugo, he meets Konatsu, a hot-headed young woman who was taken in by Yakumo after her father's tragic death. Konatsu dreams of becoming a Rakugo performer, but the path is not available to her as a woman. Despite this, she is determined to make a name for herself in the world of Rakugo.

Yakumo, Yotaro, and Konatsu all have their own struggles and dark pasts, but they come together to create a unique and captivating story. As Yotaro learns more about the art of Rakugo, he discovers the true meaning of family and what it means to be a master of the art form.

Set in Japan's Showa Genroku era (1960s to early 1970s), "Shouwa Genroku Rakugo Shinjuu: Yotarou Hourou-hen" is a heartwarming and emotional tale about the power of storytelling and the importance of following one's dreams. With its captiv
